title: astraZeneca's Covid-19 Vaccine and it's potential side effects
self_text: The AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine (Vaxzevria) has been linked to rare but serious side effects such as thrombosis with thrombocytopenia syndrome (TTS). This condition involves blood clots combined with low platelet counts, which can lead to internal bleeding. Symptoms include severe headache, chest pain, shortness of breath, abdominal pain, leg swelling, or redness in the arm where the injection was given. Individuals experiencing these symptoms should seek immediate medical attention.  It's important for healthcare providers to be aware of TTS when administering the AstraZeneca vaccine and to monitor patients closely for any warning signs. A recent study published in The Lancet suggests that women aged 30-49 may have an elevated risk of TTS after receiving the AstraZeneca vaccine. However, other studies have found no increased risk in this age group. The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has recommended that individuals who experience TTS after vaccination should receive treatment with heparin to prevent further clotting.  The potential risks associated with the AstraZeneca vaccine must be carefully weighed against the benefits of vaccination, especially during times of high transmission of the virus.  This information is intended for educational purposes only and does not constitute medical advice. If you have concerns about your health or the COVID-19 vaccine, consult with a healthcare professional.

She keeps telling me how amazing he is and what he does, like he’s actually a person. Like, if he were alive, he would be the most boring guy ever. I don’t understand why she likes him so much; it’s like she’s trying to fit in by liking something stupid. title: a bit about the "spicy" flavor
self_text: A lot of people go online and talk about spicy flavors as if it's something new, but it really isn't. I think they can have a pretty big impact on the taste of food. But there aren't many different types of spicy flavors out there. There's chili pepper, jalapeño pepper, etc. So when someone says they want to eat a spicy dish, I don't know what to expect or how to prepare for it. They usually just throw in a bunch of spices and call it spicy. It makes me think that it's not too hard to make a spice blend that has a specific type of heat. You could even make your own hot sauce with all sorts of ingredients. I find it really interesting to see how chefs come up with unique flavor profiles and I would like to try making my own recipe someday.

title: i found out my ex cheated on me with his coworker
self_text: I was so angry and hurt when I found out my ex had been cheating on me with his coworker. It's a shame that they had to go through all this drama just to get together. The whole thing was a mess and I don't want to think about it anymore. I'm trying to move forward in my life but sometimes I can't help but feel sad or frustrated about what happened. I know it's over now but the memory still haunts me. But it wasn't just about the cheating; there were other issues between us too. We had our problems before he started seeing someone else. He was always a bit of a jerk but I thought we could work things out if we tried. Maybe I was wrong? I don't know. I have no idea what to do next. Maybe I should just forget about him completely and focus on myself. But it's hard not to dwell on the past. Sometimes I wish I could turn back time and prevent everything from happening.  I'm sorry for whatever pain I caused him, and I hope he's doing okay. It sucks that he has to deal with all these feelings as well. Let's just be honest, people make mistakes. It doesn't mean they're bad people or that you did anything wrong. They might have their reasons, even if those reasons aren't good enough. I'm just glad I learned something valuable from this experience. It's better to cut ties than to let someone drag you down with them. If they're going to be a toxic person, it's best to move on. I'm not saying he's a terrible person—maybe he's just struggling with something himself. But I can't keep being involved in his problems. My mental health comes first. So I'm letting go of the past and moving forward. I need to find peace and happiness, and I won't allow anyone to steal that from me. I'll remember what happened and use it to grow stronger. I'll learn from my mistakes and make sure I never repeat them. This situation made me realize how important it is to protect my heart. I deserve to be treated with respect and kindness. I won't settle for less. And if someone tries to take advantage of me, I'll stand up for myself. I'll never give up on finding love again. I believe in second chances, but only if it's meant to be. I'm focusing on building a happy and fulfilling life for myself. No more regrets!  I am grateful for the lessons I have learned. I will never look back on this chapter with sadness. I am moving forward with confidence and joy. Life is beautiful and full of possibilities. I am excited to see what the future holds. Thank you for listening.  If anyone needs to talk, I'm here. Please seek professional help if you are struggling with difficult emotions. There are resources available to support you.  It's okay to ask for help. You are not alone. Don't suffer in silence. Reach out to loved ones, friends, or professionals.  Take care of yourself. ❤️🙏🏼

title: a little bit of spice
self_text: I was walking through the grocery store and saw an older man at the spice rack looking at the red pepper flakes with a look of disgust. He turned around to me and said "I don't know what they do to these things but it just tastes like salt" - which is so funny because it's not really even spicy but there is still flavour. I went up to him and said "It is just spices dude!" he looked confused as if he had never been exposed to anything other than pure salt. This reminded me of my dad when he tried spicy ramen for the first time.  He hated it and said it tasted like poison and then he proceeded to complain about how much he hated the texture and how it made his stomach hurt.  I thought to myself that he was a terrible person. But then i started thinking maybe he just didn't know how to enjoy the experience. And also, he has been eating salty foods his entire life, so he probably has no idea what spices taste like.  So yeah, I guess we all have our preferences on food. It's kinda funny that people think that the only way to make something tasty is by adding sugar or salt when there's so many other ways to add flavor.

title: No title
self_text: I was at the store yesterday and a kid about 6 years old walked up to me with his mom holding his hand and he said “I wanna buy that thing!” I asked her what thing he was talking about and she replied “He’s been asking for a bottle of those energy drinks” My first thought was “What kinda shit is this?” Then I realized it was probably my turn to have an embarrassing moment in front of strangers but I just stared at him and continued walking and ignored him because I felt like everyone could see how awkward it was.  Then my mind went into overdrive as I wondered if the kid was going to be asking for money or something else stupid so I looked back again and saw him trying to get the attention of his mom and then he started yelling “I want it! I WANT IT!” It made me think back to when I was younger and I would try to get my parents to buy me stuff that they didn’t want me to have like candy and chips all day. This guy looks like he’s struggling with the same issue and I can relate to him. I think that we need more people out there who understand the struggles of growing up and trying to get your parents to buy you things that you want but they don’t want you to have.  I feel like I could help this kid out by buying him whatever he wants but I also know that I can’t afford to spend that much money on a kid who probably doesn’t even need it. I wish that I had a better understanding of how to help kids like this one and I hope that they can find someone to look after them.

title: AITA for not joining the school's dance team?
self_text: I live in a small town and my high school has a really competitive dance team.  I’ve always loved watching them perform, but I never had the confidence or skills to join. This year, they held auditions and I was encouraged by my best friend (who's on the team) to try out.  She said it would be a great experience and help me build confidence. She didn’t pressure me at all; she just told me how much fun she thought I’d have.  I went to the first few practices and I realized I wasn’t as good as everyone else. I can move, but I don't have rhythm. The other girls were super dedicated and talented, and I felt like I was holding them back.  I also started to feel really insecure about myself because everyone else was so confident and amazing. I felt like I was embarrassing myself and making the whole team look bad.  I told my best friend that I wasn't going to audition anymore, and she understood. She said she respected my decision and didn’t think I needed to push myself too hard.  But then, her mom saw me at practice and told me I should join the team and that she knew I could do it!  Now, my best friend is giving me the silent treatment. Is AITA for not joining the dance team?

title: a bit of an issue with my ass
self_text: I’m trying to be as respectful and polite as possible but it feels like I’m getting ignored. I've been posting videos about the way things have been going here and there have been some issues that need to be addressed. I think people have been scared to come forward because they don’t want to risk their careers or reputations. Well, shame on them.  I’ve seen some comments saying “what do you even know?” which honestly is not fair. They are all so quick to point fingers at me when they have been actively involved in these issues for years. What makes me feel like the worst person in the world is how quickly everyone will turn against someone who speaks up or tries to bring light to the truth. You see? I’ve done everything I can to try and educate people on what has been happening here. Now I realize that it isn’t enough, it would seem that nothing I say actually gets through to anyone. This is also a really frustrating situation, especially since most of the people involved are constantly talking down to me and trying to make me look stupid.   You may have noticed I haven’t been active here recently, and it’s because I've been dealing with a lot of personal problems. I was trying to keep my head above water and ignore everything, but eventually, it just became too much.  I needed to take some time off from everything else to sort out my mental health. So I’m taking this time to focus on myself and get back on track.  I appreciate all the support I’ve received, and I hope to be able to continue helping others in the future. I want to thank everyone who’s taken the time to read this and understand what’s been happening here. I sincerely apologize if I’ve upset anyone, and I promise to always strive to improve my communication skills.  I believe that by working together, we can create a more positive and inclusive community. Thank you again for your understanding.

title: I'm so sick of people using "AI" as a catch-all term for everything they don't understand
self_text: The amount of times people say "AI" when it could be literally anything is insane. Like, if you saw someone use the word "quantum" to describe a simple mechanical problem, you'd know they were just using the word to sound smart and not actually understanding what was happening.  The same thing is true with AI. There are many ways to create intelligent systems (or things that can appear intelligent), but there are also many problems where creating an "intelligent system" would be completely unhelpful or even impossible.  I get why people want to use the word because it's cool and sounds complicated, but it really does no one any good to throw around such a loaded word unless you have a specific reason to do so.  Just say "system" or something else.

title: AITA for not wanting to be a slave?
self_text: I'm an 18-year-old black girl living in America and recently had a discussion with my parents about going to college. My parents are immigrants from Liberia, where they grew up during the civil war and experienced extreme poverty. They want me to go to college because they believe it will give me more opportunities than they had. However, I am completely uninterested in attending college. I don’t see the value in spending four years of my life racking up debt so that I can work a job that I hate for the rest of my life. Instead, I want to start my own business and build something for myself.  My parents think this is foolish and irresponsible, and that I should do what they did and go to college. But when I told them that I have no desire to do anything that they would have done, they immediately accused me of not appreciating their sacrifices. They said that if I didn’t go to college, then I was essentially rejecting their efforts to provide for me, which is insulting to me because I appreciate everything they’ve done for me. The reason I haven't gone to college is because I know what it’s like to live without money, and I don’t want to end up in that situation again.  I also feel like my parents aren’t really understanding what it means to build a company from scratch; they just assume that it’s easy money. As someone who has grown up with financial instability, I find this perspective incredibly frustrating. So yeah, basically I want to start a business, but my parents think I'm being ungrateful by not following the path they set out for me. AITA?

title: I’ve been thinking about the potential for a “return to school” since they said they were going to cancel it.
self_text: Well, here we go.  I think it's time for me to be honest with everyone. The reason why the school cancelled the return to school was because there were too many people saying that they wanted to come back and do what was originally planned. But, now that they're cancelling the return to school again, I think it's time for me to share my thoughts on how I feel about everything.  I know a lot of people are probably feeling down about this but I can say that if the school cancels the return to school again, then I will be taking action myself.  I'm not sure what actions I'll take just yet but I will let everyone know when I have figured out more details.   The reason I’m bringing up all of this is to show you guys that I am aware of your feelings and that I sympathize with what you may be going through. And yeah, I know that these things happen but please don’t lose hope or give up on yourselves. Keep trying to do whatever you want to do so that you can live your lives to the fullest. I know that many people might not understand my message but I do need to leave this out there. This is my way of telling you guys that I care about what you’re going through and I want you to keep doing what makes you happy. If you can’t do that, then I understand, but I still want you to know that I’m here for you and I will always be here for you. Also, if you need someone to talk to, then please don’t hesitate to reach out to me as well. You don’t have to deal with all of this alone. There are other people who care about you and want to help you get through it. You also shouldn’t worry about reaching out to anyone because they won’t judge you or anything like that. Everyone has different problems in their own life and everyone needs support at some point.  I just want you guys to know that I'm here to tell you to keep fighting. Fight for your dreams, fight for your goals, and fight for yourself. Don't ever give up on yourself or your beliefs. You have to believe that you can achieve anything you set your mind to. Remember that you are important and that you deserve to be happy.  You should never give up on your dreams no matter how hard it gets.  Don't ever give up on yourself, either.  Everyone says that you need to make sacrifices in order to get where you want to go but it doesn't mean that you have to sacrifice everything.  There are ways to balance your responsibilities and your passions.  If you're struggling to find that balance, then don't be afraid to ask for help.  There are resources available to help you.  I know that it can be difficult to admit that you need help but it's okay to ask for it.  It doesn't make you weak or vulnerable.  It actually takes strength to admit that you need help and to seek it out.  You can be strong and vulnerable at the same time.  And remember that you are not alone.  There are people who love you and care about you.  You can always count on them for support.  And if you don't have anyone to turn to, then you can always call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline. They can provide you with confidential support and guidance.  They are available 24/7.  You can call them at 988.  Please don't hesitate to reach out to them if you need help.  I know that things can be tough sometimes.  But I want you to know that you are not alone.  You are loved and valued.  And you have the power to change your life.  So don’t give up on yourself.  Keep fighting.  Keep believing.  Keep dreaming.  And most importantly, keep living.  Thank you for reading this post and thank you for listening. I appreciate you for giving me a platform to share my thoughts and ideas with everyone. title: a sick tiktok girl
self_text: I just saw a tiktok where a girl said she was cutting her ears off because she was so sad and lonely. She had the knife out in her hand and was about to cut her ear off when her mom came in and stopped her. The comment section was filled with people saying they were going to cut their own ears off too, like it’d make them feel better or something. It’s so messed up how mental health services aren’t available for everyone.  If you or someone you know is struggling with suicidal thoughts please reach out to the Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 988 or text HOME to 741741.

title: I was at the gym today and saw a girl with an extremely big tattoo on her arm. She wasn’t wearing a shirt or anything, so it looked like a giant ass scar. I thought she had a scar but as I got closer I realized it was just a tattoo. WTF?

title: How does a vegan get the same amount of protein from eating beans as a meat eater does?
self_text: I’ve been reading about how vegans can get enough protein, but I don’t really understand how they do it.  A meat eater will eat, say, 200 grams of chicken breast and get, say, 50 grams of protein. A vegan would have to eat a huge quantity of beans (say, 3 cups) to get 50 grams of protein. But why is that? Why isn’t it just like 1 cup of beans = 50 grams of protein?

title: "I don't know if I should ask for help"
self_text: The whole point of being a person is to live through things and not to fall apart because they happen. You're allowed to have feelings, but you can't let them overwhelm you to the point where you can't function. If you're feeling down or anxious, it's okay to talk about it with someone who cares about you, like a friend, family member, or therapist. It's also okay to seek professional help if you need it. There are many resources available online and in your community that can offer support and guidance. Don't be afraid to reach out to these resources if you're struggling. You deserve to feel better, and there are people who want to help you get there.  If you're having thoughts of hurting yourself or others, please seek immediate help. You can call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 988 or text HOME to 741741 to reach the Crisis Text Line. These services are free, confidential, and available 24/7. You are not alone, and help is always available. Remember, you are valued, and your life matters.  There are many ways to cope with difficult emotions, such as exercise, meditation, journaling, spending time in nature, or engaging in hobbies. Find what works best for you and incorporate it into your routine. It’s important to take care of your mental and emotional health, just as you would take care of your physical health. When we see our bodies hurt, we go to a doctor, but when our minds and hearts hurt, we tend to ignore it. This isn't fair to ourselves, so please treat your mental health with the same care and attention as your physical health.  If you're looking for more information on mental health, here are some helpful resources: - MentalHealth.gov: https://www.mentalhealth.gov/ - SAMHSA National Helpline: 1-800-662-HELP (4357) - The Trevor Project: 1-866-488-7386 (for LGBTQ youth) - Crisis Text Line: Text HOME to 741741  Remember, you're not weak for asking for help. In fact, it takes strength and courage to admit that you're struggling and to seek support. Be kind to yourself, and allow yourself to heal. You deserve happiness, peace, and joy. Don't give up on yourself. ❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🖤🤍🤎❤️🧡

title: AITA for making my wife take a break from her job?
self_text: My wife is working two jobs and I don’t think she should be doing that. She's been complaining about burnout lately. I told her she needs to take a week off or more and she said she can't because it'll hurt our finances. I asked if we could work on the finances together so she could take a break but she just keeps saying she has no time. If she doesn't stop working, she will burn out. Is it my fault she's in this situation? AITA for telling her she needs to take a break?

title: AITA for not wanting to go out tonight?
self_text: My friends keep texting me about going out tonight and I just wanna stay in but they say its cool if I don't. They just keep asking me why I am not coming out and I have been telling them a few times that I am just tired, sick or something like that.  I’m also getting really anxious thinking about going out so I think maybe it would be best if I didn’t go out at all. But I can’t seem to stop them from pushing me to go out.

title: AITA for calling out my friend for being a problematic person?
self_text: My friend has been very toxic lately, and I don't know how to address it. She is a racist and she has always had a very poor attitude towards people who are different than her. I have tried talking to her about it before, but she just ignores me or gets defensive. Today I saw her making fun of someone for their appearance, and it was so obvious that she was trying to hurt them.  I confronted her about it, and she got really angry and said I was trying to start a fight with her. Then she started saying some horrible things about the person whose appearance she made fun of. I didn't know what to do, but I told her that I would not be around her anymore because I can't stand by and watch her hurting people. She asked me if I was a coward, which I thought was pretty rude. Now I feel like I should have stayed with her.  I don't want to cut ties with her completely, but I also don't want to be part of her toxicity. So I am asking if I did something wrong?

title: Who is the current CEO of Nike?
self_text: I keep hearing about them and how they’re getting sued for something, but I don’t know who their current CEO is. Is it Michael Jordan? Or someone else?

title: AITA for not attending a friend's wedding?
self_text: My best friend got engaged and we're planning the wedding in July. I was super excited when she first told me about it but now that its actually coming up I am feeling more anxious than anything. Her mom doesn't like me and constantly puts down everything I do. She also has a lot of drama with her dad which makes things stressful and I don't want to get involved. I have been going through a hard time lately with my mental health and it feels like a lot to handle on top of being happy for her. title: AITA for taking a break from my friends and family?
self_text: I'm currently dealing with my mom who has been going through a lot recently (her husband passed away about 2 years ago). She has been struggling with depression and anxiety, and it's been really hard for her to cope with everything. My dad wasn't the most supportive guy during their marriage, and she hasn't gotten over him yet.  I've always tried to be there for her, but lately, she's been constantly calling me every day or multiple times a day, telling me how much she misses her husband, asking me if I think he still loves her, etc.  It's been draining me emotionally, and I can't keep up with that level of constant neediness. My brother doesn't seem to understand why I need a break, as he says "you should be there for your mom". But I genuinely feel like I have already done my part. I go visit her regularly, help her with errands, and make sure she takes care of herself. I even offered to pay for therapy sessions for her, which she refused.   My other friends and family members have noticed that I've been distant lately and don't try to reach out as often. They just tell me to "be more understanding" and say that I shouldn't take so much on myself.  I think they're right, but I'm struggling with feeling guilty for not being able to provide the emotional support she needs.  I know I should be helping her in whatever way I can, but I also need to protect my own mental health.  AITA for needing a break from her constant calls?

title: Why does it feel like the only people who can spell correctly at school are in my class?
self_text: I've had a really hard time spelling when writing essays and homework assignments in school since elementary school. My teachers have always told me they see how I struggle with spelling but then they let me get away with not doing anything about it, so now I just end up being very bad at spelling and I hate it because my grades suffer as a result. There were times where I was stuck and didn't know what to write next or how to spell something, and all of my friends would have an answer for me while I was completely clueless. Now that I'm older, I still find myself struggling to spell words, and even if I do, they often come out wrong and sometimes I don't know why. Some of my classmates are able to spell perfectly without any errors and they seem to be able to read words as well as they spell them. I've been wondering why they're so good at spelling when I can't do it at all. The reason for this is that there are several reasons that could explain why some students are better at spelling than others. First, the way that we learn to spell differs greatly from person to person. Some people might learn through rote memorization, which means they simply memorize a word by repeating it over and over again until it becomes ingrained in their memory. Other people might learn through phonetic analysis, which means they try to sound out the words and figure out how they're spelled based on the sounds that each letter makes. Still other people may learn through visual cues, such as associating letters with shapes or colors. Second, some people may have an easier time learning to spell than others due to genetic factors. For example, individuals with certain genes are more likely to develop dyslexia, which can make it difficult to learn to spell. Third, some people may have a greater advantage due to early childhood experiences. For instance, children who are exposed to language-rich environments and given ample opportunities to read and write may be more likely to become proficient spellers. Finally, some people may have different strengths and weaknesses that affect their ability to spell.  For example, someone who has difficulty with phonetics may excel in visual cueing. However, despite these differences, most people are able to learn to spell to some extent.  If you want to improve your spelling skills, here are some tips. Read widely and pay attention to how words are spelled. Use flashcards to help you memorize common words. Practice writing words frequently. Get feedback from others on your spelling.  It's important to remember that everyone learns differently, so it's okay if you need to try a few different approaches to find what works best for you. If you're struggling with spelling, don't give up! With perseverance and dedication, you can definitely improve your skills. And if you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to ask your teacher or a tutor for help.
